page.title: 02Bletsoe Village-Population.
page.content: Bletsoe is a small village with a population of approx.260.As with many villages in this part of North Bedfordshire it has changed over the last thirty years from an agricultural to a commuter community. In the early 1960's the largest farm in the village,Castle Farm,was sold and all the workers made redundant by the new owners.These people moved out of the village to find work and so left housing avalible for newcomers able to commute to Bedford and other centres of employment.At the same time new building was taking place and this housing was also purchased by people who did not work in the village.In 1963 40% of the population worked in agriculture today the figure is only 12%.The age-sex structure of the village has also changed from an elderly population to much younger.
